summary: This bill, the Responsible Retirement of Law Enforcement Firearms Act of 2025 (RRLEF Act of 2025), amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 regarding the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance Grant Program. Specifically, it introduces a certification requirement preventing grant applicants and recipients from transferring firearms to or purchasing firearms from licensed dealers on a list of dealers with a high rate of short time-to-crime firearms. The bill also mandates the Attorney General to notify law enforcement agencies about firearms traced to their transfers and to publish a list of covered licensed dealers. Finally, it addresses limitations on public disclosure of Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives database information.
